Yroima was a great host - great communication if you needed anything but also respected personal space and privacy. Exactly what I was looking for. Would definitely recommend to others traveling solo and would love to stay here again the next time I'm in the area!

review_text:
This home is very charming, beautifully decorated and very clean. The bed is incredibly cozy. The shower is spacious but the water is not very hot, only warm, it's a shame in the cold.
The welcome was very brief, our hostess seemed to have people at the house, the walls are thin and we heard everything as if we were there. However, she was very responsive by message and was happy to answer our questions.
Dishes are provided, there is enough to make a meal for two, but then nothing to wash everything. If you plan to eat multiple times at the home, this may be a problem.
The place is close to the airport, a bus line passes right in front, and you can also go to amusement parks by Uber for cheap.

review_text:
Overall, this was a cute little Casita! It was extremely quiet, there was enough coffee and toilet paper (I've been to places where there wasn't enough TP and had to buy my own). Christie had left some snacks and water and all the things you might need during your stay.
The only cons, in my opinion, were the window in the bathroom and the bed. There was no shade. It felt a little uncomfortable to shower. And, the bed was too soft for me.
Other than that, it was a great place. Christie even offered us to take our time checking out, but our flight was leaving fairly early so we couldn't take advantage of her offer. :(
Thank you, Christie!

name: Julie
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

·
September 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Christie and Evan are Super Hosts for a reason. Before I arrived I asked questions and they offered suggestions on beaches. When I arrived, checkin was easy and instructions were clear. As a minimalist this place had everything I needed: a bed/bathroom and coffee maker, microwave and refrigerator. when I asked for much needed beach items for rest and relaxation, they provided them in a timely manner. A clean place 5 mins from a conference I attended. I was able to come home between sessions for lunch and relaxation. The bed was comfortable and towels soft.
I do not use the toll roads when coming to Florida. The beach was about an hour and 20 mins away with no toll roads or freeways. I went Cocoa Beach, to the 16th street beach. Non tourist and free parking. Later I went to Cocoa Beach Pier and ate at Pier 62. Great atmosphere with locals & cruse ship and regular tourists. If you are looking for a mom and pop shop for food, I recommend Jack and Mary’s in Orlando.

The bed was a little hard for my liking but that’s a personal preference. A memory foam topper would have made it even more heavenly. Overall very satisfied with our stay. Close to the airport and <10min away from Don Julio's restaurant, which is without a doubt the best mexican food I've ever had. And I cannot say enough kind things about Christie and her hospitality. Her thoughtfulness is evident in every detail, from offering beach supplies to complimentary tabletop smores. She knew it was my birthday and even went so far as to get me a cupcake. Made my entire weekend. Needless to say, I would stay here again in a heartbeat! Thank you again Christie!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Alba's unit was wonderful. Nicely remodeled with beautiful flooring, state of the art shower and comfortable recliners. The bathroom was very clean with unique features. Such as a LED lit touchscreen mirror that doesn't fog up, large rainfall showerhead with wand. Shampoo, body wash, shave cream, q-tips and more were provided. The towels were the softest I've ever used. ( I looked up the brand and will be buying for my own home) I had a 3 hour flight that very turbulent so no food or beverage services were provided. I walked into the unit parched and hungry. Alba provided a few bottles of water and crackers as a complimentary snack! Just what I needed to hold me over before I went to dinner. Only complaint I have was every now and then the water pipes in the bathroom would start to make a whiney noise randomly. Turned on the sink and flushed the toilet to fix each time. Not a bother at all. I didn't explore the neighborhood at all. Would rent again.

review_text:
My recent stay at Alba's Guest Suite was nothing short of delightful. From the moment I arrived, I was warmly welcomed by the host
The studio exuded a sense of cozy sophistication. The decor was tasteful and modern, with thoughtful touches that made me feel right at home. The space was impeccably clean.
One of the highlights of my stay was undoubtedly the location. It is literally less than 20 minutes from the airport. It is also near many restaurants, attractions, and shops. The studio was surprisingly peaceful, offering a tranquil retreat from the hustle and bustle.
The host was responsive and accommodating. Overall, my experience exceeded all expectations, and I would wholeheartedly recommend this Alba's Guest Suite to anyone looking for a cozy and convenient place to stay in Orlando, near MCO. I certainly hope to have the opportunity to return in the future.

The location was nice being close to the airport and the drive to both Disney/Universal was about 25 minutes. Obviously the nightmare of I4 traffic may change that, but that is unavoidable when visiting those parks. Definitely recommend staying here if you are planning on spending your days fully at a park and need someplace to come back to sleep and shower at.

She left some snacks for me for when I checked in. It was very nice, safe and quiet environment. It’s also close to a few grocery stores and family dollar. Alba is very nice, she replaced my used towels with clean ones. She replied quick and even accepted the Amazon package for me. It was a great place to stay in. I would love to book her place again when I return to Orlando. Definitely worth the price I paid for. Thank you so much, Alba!

Stayed with kids
review_text: This home was so gorgeous! We loved it here so much. We stayed here for one night after spending a week at a Universal Studios resort. This was the perfect place to unwind after the hustle and bustle of a theme park before flying home. It was a small space, as advertised, but so cute and secluded. The view out the windows was so peaceful to sit and enjoy a cup of coffee. The hot tub with twinkle lights overhead was so calm at night after a long day. We stayed with our toddler, and the host put out some toys for him that he was so excited to see and play with! Also the home was a half hour drive to many of the Orlando destinations. The only thing that was frustrating was that the neighbors were quite loud that night and although it didn't bother the toddler, it did wake us up a few times. But I know it's hard to control that! We just didn't expect it. We really enjoyed staying here!

what is a Yurt you may ask... like I asked when I saw this Yurt on the Air B n B site under interesting places to stay. I was so excited to come see and stay at this yurt. Paul's yurt was more than I expected!! I recommend this quaint and beautifully serine and adventurous yurt to everyone! Immaculate/Quiet/Romantic/Serine/Natural/and Exhilarating!
We wish we had booked for Two nights... maybe next time?!?
Paul was proactive in communications and in making us aware of his hospitality and availability. The Uber Eats dropped off our food to his door instead of the Yurt door (even though we gave directions to come past the houses to the Yurt). Paul walked the food down to us. ☺️ this was a TOP NOTCH Air B n B and Experience! We give this Yurt the A++ Seal of Approval!! Thank you Paul (and Mrs. Paul) for this Extraordinary Experience and sharing your little corner of the world with us!
Thank YOU!! God Bless!!
We will be back and we will tell everyone about this Hidden Gem!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Amazing location in a beautiful and safe neighborhood! Joey was extremely friendly and flexible with my check-in and check-out times. The room is simple and comfortable, with GREAT PILLOWS and a delicious bed. The area offers a variety of restaurants and cafes, and is great for walking, renting bikes or scooters, and using public transportation, making it easy and inexpensive to get around the city. However, there are some aspects to improve: the air conditioning was a little old and noisy, the buzzing stunned me and I was sick, the shower had a strange configuration that could be uncomfortable for tall people, and the shower curtain had mold. I hope you can arrange this. Also, it is important to note that the room lacks windows other than the front door, which may be relevant for those in need of additional ventilation. For me. it was good. Despite these details, I definitely recommend this place!

name: Katrina
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
August 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Perfect spot for 1-2 visitors. The location really can’t be beat. Joey was friendly, communicative and accommodating. Meeting his sweet pup Jackson and one of his cats, Twilight, was a highlight during our trip. :)
The suite itself isn’t huge, but it has everything you would need. There’s street parking if you have a car and we never had an issue finding a close spot. Joey’s backyard area is very zen — you can tell he takes care of his place and wants his visitors to feel at home and relaxed.
Thornton Park itself is a picturesque and charming area. We had bagel sandwiches from Eola General for breakfast and did a jog around Lake Eola. Wish we could have stayed longer because there’s so many more food spots and bars nearby that we wanted to explore! If you book this place, take advantage of this lovely, walkable neighborhood.

Stayed one night
review_text: This was more than I expected for an Air BnB! they knocked it out of the park with this residence, there's a fence that keeps you secluded enough but everything is within walking distance. I didn't know where to start when I got hungry with all of the places, but there's a lovely list of recommendations right in the room. I forgot soap for he shower and I thought I was SOL, but then I hopped on an electric scooter (rentable and are everywhere) and there was a seven eleven less than 5 minutes away that I could've walked there. All in all a lovely residence with excellent bars and restaurants nearby. they also have a mini fridge with water in it as well!

name: Joe
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
July 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The neighborhood and property were very nice, private, welcoming. The space was smaller than I thought but worked well, efficient, not feeling cluttered. The older/weathered style furniture is nice but hides dirt/stains and such. The surface of the only desk was sticky, spotty. Bathroom was nice, good shower. If you stay here, the Shampoo and Conditioner is on the shower floor ledge, between the 2 oversized curtains... they 'hid' from me the entire trip!
The Bed was very nice, hard to find with my bad back. Clean linens, cool A/C, smart TV, fan, more than enough lighting. Overall for the price and compared to hotels around, it was a great deal and a nice experience overall.
I was able to walk over one block away and watch the Live UFC fights outside the Bars/Lounges on their outdoor TV's and watch people dancing through the front door of the other spot just across the street :)

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The perfect spot to avoid the hustle and bustle and big hotel chains around Orlando!
Joey's guesthouse is located in Thornton Park, which feels like a cozy village in the city. Nice restaurants within walking distance, Lake Eola around the corner, and close to all major highways.
The neighborhood is beautiful, feels super safe and the cottage is in a nice garden, where you have enough privacy and can also sit outside.
Inside, it's just as nice: a good bed (including enough firm pillows) , nice shower, and everything clean.
Joey is easy to reach and responds quickly to messages. If we were ever going to Orlando again, we would definitely stay here again!

review_text: We really enjoyed our stay here! Joey was very friendly and responsive, and check-in was a breeze. The cottage is charming, private, and clean. Street parking is easy. The neighborhood is gorgeous and quite special--if you love Arts and Crafts housing, this is the place to be! There are excellent bars/cafes/restaurants just two blocks away and the location is convenient to other parts of Orlando. This is a perfect place for a couple or single traveler who wants a peaceful spot in a lovely, safe, walkable, and historic neighborhood. We highly recommend it!

There were 3 room spays/linen sprays in the room that we used but only worked to blend with the smoke smell for a few minutes. We even tried our faithful trick of whole coffee beans in a bowl. Nothing worked for us. Unfortunately, it even came home with us and I have been working to get the smoke smell out of our clothes, luggage, and even a fabric craft project I took with me.

rating_info:
Rating, 2 stars
,

August 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: The unit is very cute and well equipped for such a small space. We do have a few complaints, there are two bathroom doors that interfere with each other, it would be helpful to please remove one of them. Unfortunately our stay was during a very hot time in August. The AC could not keep up in the late afternoon and we had trouble sleeping each night until things cooled down in the middle of night. Also, the bed pillows should probably be replaced. They are thin and a little lumpy and worn out. Lastly there is a smell of cigarettes when you first arrive, you get used to it but each time you leave and return again it smells very strong. We were able to handle it but a highly sensitive person would find it difficult. The location was great and overall that was why we chose this unit. We highly recommend Hawkers Asian Street food just around the corner and the free parking across the street was very convenient.

The space was cute and cozy and just right for me as a solo traveller. I appreciated being able to use the laundry unit—super convenient and saved me some luggage space!
Overall, it was a great experience. Yana’s team is super friendly and quick to respond. Check in and check out was easy. I would recommend this location for sure.

review_text:
The Airbnb was okay, and is accurately represented in the photos. The bed is big enough for two people. It’s not very spacious, however it was big enough for me and my partner. I liked the layout of it, they did provide us with soap, a hair dryer with attachments, an iron, etc. We had some difficulty with the ac/heater unit and it not blowing out hot air, so it was pretty cold during our stay.
The parking is across the street, however it is connected to what I believe is a popular bar. So when we would arrive back from doing activities after 7pm, it would be pretty difficult to find a spot. We had to circle the lot a couple of times on certain nights. I think the area was generally ok, but was in a busier spot.
I would recommend staying here, with the exception of those two things I think my stay was fine.

name: Sydney
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
August 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: I really wanted to give Yana’s sweet guest house 5 stars, but unfortunately I can’t due to a few reasons. The location and cleanliness of the place was great; however, I ran into a few issues while staying there. The AC unit does not make the place very cool, and according to a light that was on, I think that the filter may need to be cleaned/replaced. I wish that had been kept up with because Florida in July is HOT. Then on my second day, I was blow drying my hair with the dryer that they have there and it tripped the breaker for the entire guest house. I messaged Yana and it took her a bit to respond as she was out. Meanwhile, it got extremely hot in the house and I was in the middle of trying to get ready with no power. Finally she responded but then I had to wait another 20 mins (close to an hour total without power) for her husband to get home to fix it. Thankfully he was able to. The morning of my last day, I ran out of the only roll of toilet paper I could find in the house, which wasn’t even a full roll when I check in. I messaged Yana asking if she could bring out some more and unfortunately did not hear back until after I checked out. I’m not sure if I was supposed to stock the house with TP myself, but I didn’t feel like I should’ve had to. I could be wrong. I also feel like if you run an Airbnb, you should either have a property manager (or whoever) in charge of all the communication so that it can be done in a timely manner, or the owner should constantly be on top of messaging back and forth in case something is wrong. Otherwise, Yana seemed sweet during communication when I first booked her place and the guesthouse itself is super cute and in a safe location. One last thing is that there was no dish soap to be found, so I wasn’t sure how to wash the few kitchen utensils I used. The space provided paper plates and plastic cutlery, so once I noticed that, I used that instead. But unfortunately the dishes attracted some ants, even thought I tried to wipe them clean with paper towels in the meantime.

I am all about reviews so let me get started.
Location : probably the best location I’ve ever had. Especially for my age group, there are two bars within 50 feet of the place where you can get drinks and takeout.
Neighbors : Super friendly and inviting. They had great recommendations on food.
Food : go to seven bites but make sure you get there early, there’s always a long wait.
Parking : we came at a bad time, Friday at 6 PM so the parking lot was very full and I had to wait for parking. No biggie for me, that might be an issue for a larger family. The parking lot is directly across from the Airbnb.

review_text: I really enjoyed the space and the location. There were awesome bars with great cocktails within walking distance. Parking was across the street and free. Two people is what I would recommend at MOST! Even a small child (with a couple) would push you over the max. The shower is small, but will get the job done. The bed was a great sleep (my partner disagrees), firm but memory foam that made it really comfortable. Yana was really easy to get a hold of and the in unit laundry was a great asset. In all, I’d definitely recommend this place and it helped make my trip that much better.

review_text:
We loved our stay! The place was very clean and had a fenced in yard for my pups. We didn’t use the pool because it rained most of the time, but it was a nice feature. Would stay here again for sure…
A few non-deal breakers to keep in mind:
-at night the ducks sound like they’re murdering each other. I’m used to living in a loud area so this wasn’t a deal breaker. Just took me by surprise.
-bring shampoo/toiletries. The small amounts they provide were only enough for one day. Again not a deal breaker since the stores are nearby and we could buy some.
-the master room bed was not very comfortable and may have a hole in it.
-my dog found old/moldy dog treats in the yard. There was also some poop left behind from previous guests. (Again non deal breakers but be aware in case you step on it.)

Rating, 5 stars

,

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
If I could give this place a 10-star review, I would.
Katies and Scott's apartment is not only quiet, but also has every comfort that travelers need to recover from things to do in and around Orlando. From the fridge to the blinds on the windows to the air mattresses in the super clean and amazingly deep swimming pool - everything is chosen with love and super clean.
Both the airport and the attraction in and around Orlando are easily accessible by car. Possibilities to have breakfast and dinner are also close. If you have any questions, the landlords are always available; there are also helpful tips in a manual to find your way around Orlando and the really beautiful, idyllic neighborhood (restaurants, supermarket, etc.).
We would book the accommodation again at any time. We only lovingly call the pool house "Barbies Dreamhouse".

We will definitely be staying again!

It was immaculate upon arrival, fully loaded with all the essentials needed at this type of stay and comparable to items a hotel would provide plus more. They even welcomed us with a beautiful basket of personalized items, including a Mr. And Mrs. mugs which became momento from our honeymoon. I actually found experiencing the ambiance and vibe to be better in person when you see it all together. While it was the backyard of this lovely couples home, it was truly a private oasis and they made our stay as comfortable as possible. The parking spot was great as we rented a vehicle for our stay though not needed for the area since it is walkable. Katie provided recommendations for restaurants and they were all 10/10. I highly recommend that if you stay here, plan to have a few days to chill at the house as you won’t regret it. There’s nothing more you could want. Thanks again for a perfect stay!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Katie and Scott’s place was just how it was listed, very private and quiet. It was very easy to locate and to gain entry, Katie and Scott live in the main house but they keep their back blinds closed to it makes the pool house very private indeed. The garden area in beautiful, lots of seating areas and if we had stayed longer we would have made use of the pool and the bbq area. The pool house was very well equipped with everything you need, the bed comfortable and a lovely shower room. Nearby you can find some local shops for food and around the lake we found a nice restaurant and a great wine bar that does nibbles aswell. You are also only 20 mins away from downtown and the main streets with lots of bars and restaurants. We meet Scott one evening with his small dog in the front garden, he was very friendly and told us about a rocket launch the next morning which we would be able to see from the garden, we were up to watch it, we couldn’t see the rocket but saw the vapour trail.

The space was clean and inviting. The kitchen space is bare bones- a sink, mini fridge, Keurig and microwave, but the grill enabled us to cook a meal or two. The whole place was light and airy. Comfy bed and nice shower for those folks who are wondering.
Highly recommend going to the Lake Eola farmers market on Sunday, pizza at Anthony’s and a foot massage at Heavenly Foot Massage!

To have such a private place all to ourselves was an optimal retreat. We didn’t want to leave the poolhouse. We enjoyed playing ping pong and lodging around. Of course we were surrounded by attractions such as Lake Eola, restaurants and lovely homes in a most walkable neighborhood. Getting to downtown was a short, enjoyable walk. If you are looking for a great place to stay while in Orlando, look no further. I would much rather stay here vs the Disney resort we stayed at while visiting the Disney World.
10 out of 10. Best Airbnb we have stayed in.

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This place was great. The pool house was very clean and had everything you would want. There wasn’t anytime where we though we needed anything. Has fridge and microwave too. The pool area was beautiful. It was very private and felt secluded, we got way better sleep here than we’ve ever got at a hotel. We never saw or heard the hosts, which was great. But the best part is the location… it’s basically perfect. You’re five minutes walk to several restaurants, then 10 minutes walk to Publix and like 15 more restaurants, and then an easy 20 min walk to basically all of downtown Orlando. And we did walk all over, we felt safe at all hours (walking back from downtown at 2am), the location is just perfect.

name: Michael
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
July 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
If you have any doubts or reservations about booking this place for your trip to Orlando. Do yourself a favor and slap yourself for me, and book this place right now. This place is absolutely INCREDIBLE!!
I booked the pool house as a romantic and fun getaway for me and my girlfriend on our tenth anniversary. As soon as we opened the private entry side door to the backyard and got our first glimpse of the pool and pool house. We both looked at each other like we had struck gold. It is so pretty, private, relaxing, and well designed. It really felt like walking into our own private oasis, and this is before we even opened the door to the house. We were both giddy with excitement and couldn’t stop talking about how nice and beautiful everything was. The pool had a wonderful seating area and the fountains were such a nice touch. That gave you the calming sound of running water.
We made our way to the house, opened the door and immediately fell in love. The house is sooooo cute and made us feel at home instantly. Katie and Scott have thought out every single detail to provide the best experience possible. Everything you could ever think of needing they had already provided you with. Me and my girlfriend have been raving about this place to all our friends and family ever since. We can not wait to come back and book this place again the next time to come back to Orlando. I almost didn’t want to write this review, because in a guilty way I want to keep this place all to ourselves.
Couple highlights from our trip that really stood out about this place.
Pool shelf seating and floaties
Ping pong table and hammock
Luxurious and sizable bathroom
Ring toss game
Outdoor couch seating for poolside dining
Walking/biking distance to amazing bars and restaurants. (We really liked tin and taco)
Comfy bed with all the amazing thoughtful considerations provided by the hosts.
We had such a great time that I asked my girlfriend to marry me on 7/11/21. We took a hot air balloon ride with painted horizons tours on that morning, got down on one knee and popped the question. She said yes 💗💍😁!!
Can’t help but think this Airbnb helped seal the deal. Thanks Katie and Scott. Can’t wait to come back. Hopefully next time we get to play with your super cute doggo.
Thanks again
-Mike and Briana

We walked to dinner, the lake, the grocery store - easy! But let's get down to business...the private POOL is where it's at. I wish I had a day in Orlando just to hang out by this pool...forget Disney, grab a drink and sit poolside, grill something up, play a round of ping pong (yes...there is a ping pong table), read a book on the hammock and chill. And inside! Katie and Scott thought of it all. I mean, they even have nice towels! Honestly, just stop reading my review and book. Enjoy!

review_text: Katie and Scott’s place is a must - stay in Orlando. My wife and I stayed for a week where we were partially working and partially relaxing. The setup is great for both! Katie and Scott even provided us an extension cord by request so we could more easily work outside :) It is worth mentioning that there is a small table for two inside as well for another work spot. There were tons of great food and bar options within walking distance, and other cool areas like Winter Park were just a quick drive / Uber away. When relaxing we really enjoyed the shallow area in the pool which was great for reading with your feet in the water, the hammock, ping pong table, and nice outdoor patio/seating area. Katie and Scott were very responsive, had great local recommendations, and even had some some birthday cupcakes waiting for us when we arrived. We would definitely stay here again!

Scott and Katie were great. Very quick to respond to communications and they leave snacks and waters etc in the unit for you.
Highly recommended!

My husband and me stayed here for 5 nights for our Orlando theme park visits. The pool house is the perfect getaway home! It is in quite neighborhood. At the same time, it is minutes away from Orlando downtown and there are so many good dining options around (Hawkers Asian street food and Taco Cheena are our favorites!) And it is about 25 minutes drive to Universal studio.
The weather during our stay is a bit chill so we missed the chance to enjoy the pool. But Katie and Scott are so accommodating that they even cleaned the pool after a rainy day in case we would like to use it. The sofa and bedding is really comfy so we can really relax after a long day in the theme park.
We would definitely recommend everyone to stay here for your Orlando visit!

review_text:
Wow. You will be very happy with this spot. It’s basically it’s own resort! The design and layout are awesome and the atmosphere chilling in the pool chairs is so relaxing. The other reviews below mention quite a bit, so I will just add a few of our particular favorites...The water under the pool chairs is at the perfect level so your butt doesn’t get wet if you just want to dip your toes in!
The shower is big enough for 2 people with plenty of space and a good sized bench and the cutest custom design on the drain. Oh, and the towels are very plush & heavy duty and feel wonderful.
And the piece de resistance: (2) hotel luggage racks!! People always forget that you need somewhere to leave & work from the suitcases!
And since we didn’t have time to fully enjoy everything there is in the yard, we will be back!
Thanks!

name: Cindy

Rating, 5 stars

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Without a doubt one of the best places we could have stayed for our visit to Orlando! Being a private couple we weren’t sure how we’d like being in someone’s backyard oasis, so we asked. With quick responses from Katie - we booked the Pool house right away- so glad we did!! The pool was wonderful, but from start to finish our stay well exceeded our expectations...
Upon arrival we were greeted with the cutest entrance, definitely impressing on us that our visit would be and feel private. The pool itself was inviting, clean and looked so fun (tested & approved!!) As we entered the pool house it was apparent this couple took pride in their space, the decor lent you to feel at home and relaxed. Place even smelled fresh & clean. We enjoyed the welcoming gift, water and snacks(THANKS). Nothing about our stay felt rushed. This was much needed!
Overall I’d say this was one of the best places we’ve stayed.
*If you decide to book - we highly recommend you take advantage of the close proximity they are to restaurants & the park. Everything really is a short stroll away. In addition they were a short driving distance to The Plaza Live, where we saw Shakey Graves. The east end market, where we lunched and picked up our fav Lineage Coffee and lastly a few minutes from some neat shops we try to frequent: The Owls Attic & Dechoes.
Thanks again for a great weekend!
David & Cindy

The house is so very nicely decorated, so many attention to small details, a very nice bed. We did not leave the house for a day because we liked it so much. This is one review I'm apprehensive about writing, because I want to be sure there is always availability for ME! Selfish, I know.
The pool house was a like a dream getaway with perfectly exceptional decor from the moment you walked to the first entry door. It's very secure, was spotless (that white couch!), and lots of windows, a/c, fan, tons of tv-watching options, and a bed you won't want to leave. We even received a sweet welcome note, and a special Floridian sweet gift.
It's outfitted with everything you need, even a few snacks - how thoughtful is that.
As for the location, it's in a very clean, quiet, quaint part of town with well-cared-for surroundings.
The hosts are the best I've experienced at communicating, and fast too. So kind and gracious.
The only regret I have is we didn't spend enough time so that we could use the pool. It's really inviting to say the least. Anyway, we will be back soon.
Thank you Katie & Scott
(THE BEST AIRBNB WE HAVE EVER STAYED IN...that's the truth).

review_text: Exceptional!! This place is absolutely incredible. The home was immaculate. We had three families on this vacation and every single person had a blast! There was never time to be bored with the game room, the gaming systems, the theater room, and the pool! The beds were SO comfortable!!! The kitchen was well stocked with very nice appliances and cookware! We couldn't have asked for more. And the owners....WOW! They were SO responsive and helpful. When our Walmart order came earlier than expected (before our arrival), the hosts went to the house and brought in our groceries and even put the cold items in the fridge! You can't ask for more than that! Staying at this house alone was a vacation in itself, but if you are in the area for Disney like we were, it was such a quick and easy drive. The kids loved the bunkbed rooms with the slides and the Mario Kart room so much, they were ready to leave Disney and get back to playing at the house! You can't beat that!!

The kids were constantly entertained - so much so that they preferred spending time at the house over going out to the town or visiting theme parks. It became a highlight of their vacation, which speaks volumes about the amenities and environment provided.Chris, our host, was outstanding in his hospitality. He responded promptly to all our questions and made sure our stay was comfortable and enjoyable. His attentiveness added greatly to our positive experience.We wholeheartedly recommend this Airbnb to any family, big or small. It's well worth it for the quality of stay, the exceptional entertainment for children, and the superb communication from the host.

From the lights, the TVs, the furniture, and the games this place was awesome. My five year old had the time of his life. The location is easy to get to anything you may need and the drive to Disney/Universal is easy as well. If you’re on the fence about spending the money DO NOT HESITATE, it is worth every penny. The host was super friendly and responsive, check in was a breeze and everything worked as described. The grill, the pool, all of it was A+++ and we are looking into coming back next Christmas. review_text:
It is our goal when we travel to stay in a house unlike our own and experience next level accommodations. This home did just that and then more!
The first thing that caught our attention was the game room. It was like stepping into a miniature arcade, complete with a wide range of arcade games, a pool table, and air hockey. Our whole family had a blast spending time competing and enjoying quality time together.
But that was just the beginning. The themed rooms with slides were an instant hit with our kids. Each room had its own unique theme, from Frozen with a princess castle to Mario Kart. Our kids couldn't get enough of sliding down into their own private play area right off their bed. The attention to detail was truly remarkable.
We spent our nights after returning from the parks swimming and enjoying the poolside BBQ area. Then off to the in home theater to cap off the night!
The Host was incredibly responsive and went above and beyond to make sure our stay was amazing!

The only con about the home was the pool heating system did not provide the pool and warm but the Jacuzzi was very hot, pool was still cold. Thank you for allowing my family to enjoy your home.
